channel.title: CVE Feed for Kubernetes -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Kubernetes -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-2728|2024-08-02T06:33:05.263Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: Users may be able to launch containers that bypass the mountable secrets policy enforced by the ServiceAccount admission plugin when using ephemeral containers. The policy ensures pods running with a service account may only reference secrets specified in the service account’s secrets field. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if the ServiceAccount admission plugin and the `kubernetes.io/enforce-mountable-secrets` annotation are used together with ephemeral containers.

item.title: CVE-2023-3893|2024-08-02T07:08:50.687Z -- kubernetes -- csi-proxy
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where a user that can create pods on Windows nodes running kubernetes-csi-proxy may be able to escalate to admin privileges on those nodes. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if they include Windows nodes running kubernetes-csi-proxy.

item.title: CVE-2023-3955|2024-08-02T07:08:50.695Z -- kubernetes -- kubelet
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where a user that can create pods on Windows nodes may be able to escalate to admin privileges on those nodes. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if they include Windows nodes.

item.title: CVE-2023-2727|2024-08-02T06:33:05.475Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: Users may be able to launch containers using images that are restricted by ImagePolicyWebhook when using ephemeral containers. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if the ImagePolicyWebhook admission plugin is used together with ephemeral containers.

item.title: CVE-2023-5528|2024-08-02T07:59:44.808Z -- kubernetes -- kubelet
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where a user that can create pods and persistent volumes on Windows nodes may be able to escalate to admin privileges on those nodes. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if they are using an in-tree storage plugin for Windows nodes.

item.title: CVE-2023-2431|2024-08-02T06:19:15.139Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubelet that allows pods to bypass the seccomp profile enforcement. Pods that use localhost type for seccomp profile but specify an empty profile field, are affected by this issue. In this scenario, this vulnerability allows the pod to run in unconfined (seccomp disabled) mode. This bug affects Kubelet.

item.title: CVE-2023-2878|2024-08-02T06:41:02.447Z -- kubernetes -- secrets-store-csi-driver
item.description: Kubernetes secrets-store-csi-driver in versions before 1.3.3 discloses service account tokens in logs.

item.title: CVE-2023-1174|2024-08-02T05:40:58.263Z -- kubernetes -- minikube
item.description: This vulnerability exposes a network port in minikube running on macOS with Docker driver that could enable unexpected remote access to the minikube container.

item.title: CVE-2023-1944|2024-08-02T06:05:27.072Z -- kubernetes -- minikube
item.description: This vulnerability enables ssh access to minikube container using a default password.

item.title: CVE-2023-5043|2024-08-02T07:44:53.863Z -- kubernetes -- ingress-nginx
item.description: Ingress nginx annotation injection causes arbitrary command execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-1943|2024-08-02T06:05:27.089Z -- kubernetes -- kops
item.description: Privilege Escalation in kOps using GCE/GCP Provider in Gossip Mode.

item.title: CVE-2023-3676|2024-08-02T07:01:57.315Z -- kubernetes -- kubelet
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where a user that can create pods on Windows nodes may be able to escalate to admin privileges on those nodes. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if they include Windows nodes.

item.title: CVE-2023-5044|2024-08-02T07:44:53.684Z -- kubernetes -- ingress-nginx
item.description: Code injection via nginx.ingress.kubernetes.io/permanent-redirect annotation.

item.title: CVE-2024-5321|2024-08-01T21:11:12.421Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes clusters with Windows nodes where BUILTIN\Users may be able to read container logs and NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users may be able to modify container logs.

item.title: CVE-2024-5321|2024-07-18T19:30:48.148Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes clusters with Windows nodes where BUILTIN\Users may be able to read container logs and NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users may be able to modify container logs.

item.title: CVE-2024-3744|2024-06-17T18:38:53.285Z -- kubernetes -- azure-file-csi-driver
item.description: A security issue was discovered in azure-file-csi-driver where an actor with access to the driver logs could observe service account tokens. These tokens could then potentially be exchanged with external cloud providers to access secrets stored in cloud vault solutions. Tokens are only logged when TokenRequests is configured in the CSIDriver object and the driver is set to run at log level 2 or greater via the -v flag.

item.title: CVE-2024-3744|2024-05-15T00:42:36.881Z -- kubernetes -- azure-file-csi-driver
item.description: A security issue was discovered in azure-file-csi-driver where an actor with access to the driver logs could observe service account tokens. These tokens could then potentially be exchanged with external cloud providers to access secrets stored in cloud vault solutions. Tokens are only logged when TokenRequests is configured in the CSIDriver object and the driver is set to run at log level 2 or greater via the -v flag.

item.title: CVE-2024-3177|2024-06-04T17:33:03.250Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where users may be able to launch containers that bypass the mountable secrets policy enforced by the ServiceAccount admission plugin when using containers, init containers, and ephemeral containers with the envFrom field populated. The policy ensures pods running with a service account may only reference secrets specified in the service account’s secrets field. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if the ServiceAccount admission plugin and the kubernetes.io/enforce-mountable-secrets annotation are used together with containers, init containers, and ephemeral containers with the envFrom field populated.

item.title: CVE-2024-5321|2024-07-18T18:15:25.270Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes clusters with Windows nodes where BUILTIN\Users may be able to read container logs and NT AUTHORITY\Authenticated Users may be able to modify container logs.

item.title: CVE-2024-3177|2024-08-01T20:05:07.568Z -- kubernetes -- kubernetes
item.description: A security issue was discovered in Kubernetes where users may be able to launch containers that bypass the mountable secrets policy enforced by the ServiceAccount admission plugin when using containers, init containers, and ephemeral containers with the envFrom field populated. The policy ensures pods running with a service account may only reference secrets specified in the service account’s secrets field. Kubernetes clusters are only affected if the ServiceAccount admission plugin and the kubernetes.io/enforce-mountable-secrets annotation are used together with containers, init containers, and ephemeral containers with the envFrom field populated.

item.title: CVE-2024-3744|2024-08-01T20:20:01.141Z -- kubernetes -- azure-file-csi-driver
item.description: A security issue was discovered in azure-file-csi-driver where an actor with access to the driver logs could observe service account tokens. These tokens could then potentially be exchanged with external cloud providers to access secrets stored in cloud vault solutions. Tokens are only logged when TokenRequests is configured in the CSIDriver object and the driver is set to run at log level 2 or greater via the -v flag.
